page.title: 07SALTBURN TRANSPORT SERVICES
page.content: Saltburn and Skelton are served by two bus companies and British Railway. Regular bus services take people to nearby towns and villages while the train service has direct links with Teeside airport and inter-city train services. In a survey we found that most people in Saltburn have their own transport which many used for getting to work. Buses were used on afternoons by elderly people with bus passes. The main complaints about public transport were the frequency of services, cost and smoking. Recent fare rises on the pay train service was unpopular. A census of Saltburn's busy main road at midday consisted mainly of cars and a few buses. Approx. 40 vans passed probably serving local shops and homes. The high number of bicycles that passed suggests that the overall traffic flow is not heavy.
